fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Budget, Competition, Taxation, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Regional Policy, Digital economy and society, Borders and Security, Communication, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives:
- anticorruption and money laundering 
- open government/ open data 
- good governance 
- public spending and public procurement 
- digital agenda 
- public participation and youth empowerement 
- fact-checking and fighting fake news
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership:
Part of the TransparenCEE network - https://transparencee.org/ 
Participation to the activities of the International Fact-checking Network - https://www.poynter.org/channels/fact-checking
relevant_communication: Our activities are mostly focused on the area of good governance and include various platforms which use civic tech: public spending (www.banipublici.ro), open justice (www.onoratainstanta.ro), anticorruption (www.piatadespaga.ro and www.maricorupti.ro), the first Romanian fact-checking platform (www.factual.ro), but also constant civic education.
goals__remit: Funky Citizens is a Romanian NGO that builds research-based, data-driven online advocacy tools that aim to be educational and actionable, encouraging citizens to engage in good governance initiatives in which they can see an impact.  Our data-driven online platforms proved their sustainability in time (with hundreds of thousands of visitors during their existence); an online and offline community of mainly young and dynamic citizens joining us in our efforts to promote good governance (we make a lot of use of our over 70.000 Facebook likes on all our platforms). We have formal or informal partnerships/ collaborations with organizations like Code for Romania, RISE Project as well as with more general media platforms (i.e. Republica.ro, Sapte Seri).
